content.description: Starts in mossy "open book." Follow crack to base of small overhang, and hand traverse under a short darker rock roof, pull up left to a small ledge, and finish straight up the short vertical face with two vertical cracks.
Boulder up the middle of the short overhang to a good slot. Fire the seams to the juggy horizontal midway up the cliff (staying right of the arete) and continue up the easy hand crack to the top.
content.protection: Very easy to set up a TR. If you're going to lead it, gear beta can be tricky to avoid mucking up the holds. Consider bringing a crash pad for the boulder problem off the deck.
content.location: Just right of the arete on the right side of the cliff.

content.description:
The first climb you come to after moving left off the approach trail to the cliff.  

  A nice climb, but I don't think the 5.7 listed in the Fasulo Guidebook!  

  P1 - Up the left-leaning crack to the face above. The move back left to the face seemed WAY more difficult than 5.7, but maybe I missed something?!  (5.8 - 5.9 ?)

START - Same as Searchlight (about 6-8 ft left of the inverted "Y" of Divining Rod.)  

  P1 - Follow the left of the two cracks to the face.

START- About 6-8 ft left of the inverted "Y" of Divining Rod are two cracks: Searchlight and Side Steppen.  

  P1 - Climb the crack that leans right, then head up through a notch.

Climb the black face and mantle onto the small shelf under the overhanging dihedral split by two cracks. Mantle and traverse left around the overhang on crimps until gaining the ledge. Scramble to the top. 

  You can avoid the crux by going left, making this climb a steady 5.8.

3 feet left of AMCer. Follow steep vertical crack on left to a good hold. Continue up shallow corner system to right of arete to a ledge. Continue up thin face to right of the arete or use the arete to the top.
Climb low angle face and crack until pulling through overhang at top

The next climb you come to on the 30-35 ft face just left of the approach trail.  

  P1 - START 5 ft left of "Small Pine" below an inverted "Y".  Up on cracks, pass right of an overlap and continue to the top on either of 2 cracks.
Follow Structures but, when you reach the overhang, move right and "bridge it" up the dihedral (crux).
content.protection: Trees for TR anchors at top
content.location: Walk off left across top of the slab, down the descent trail, and back across the base of the slab.

content.description: Starts in a short dihedral with a small sharp right hand hold. Follow vertical crack on right, over a bulge, move right onto a the face, and straight up on positive holds past 2 horizontal cracks to a small left-facing flake in the center of the face. Finish on thin holds up to the top.
The Right Side routes face east so they tend to be shadier, wetter and buggier than the Main Slab.  The routes are mostly between 25 and 40 ft. tall and offer a good range of difficulty.
